7 /* public domain, Simple, Minimalistic GIF writer - http://jonolick.com
8  *
9  * Quick Notes:
10  * Supports only 4 component input, alpha is currently ignored. (RGBX)
11  *
12  * Latest revisions:
13  * 1.00 (2015-11-03) initial release
14  *
15  * Basic usage:
16  * char *frame = new char[128*128*4]; // 4 component. RGBX format, where X is unused
17  * jo_gif_t gif = jo_gif_start("foo.gif", 128, 128, 0, 32);
18  * jo_gif_frame(&gif, frame, 4, false); // frame 1
19  * jo_gif_frame(&gif, frame, 4, false); // frame 2
20  * jo_gif_frame(&gif, frame, 4, false); // frame 3, ...
21  * jo_gif_end(&gif);
22  * */
23

32 typedef struct {
33  FILE *fp;
34  unsigned char palette[0x300];
35  short width, height, repeat;
36  int numColors, palSize;
37  int frame;
38 } jo_gif_t;
39 
40 // width/height | the same for every frame
41 // repeat | 0 = loop forever, 1 = loop once, etc...
42 // palSize | must be power of 2 - 1. so, 255 not 256.
43 inline jo_gif_t jo_gif_start(const char *filename, short width, short height, short repeat, int palSize);
44 
45 // gif | the state (returned from jo_gif_start)
46 // rgba | the pixels
47 // delayCsec | amount of time in between frames (in centiseconds)
48 // localPalette | true if you want a unique palette generated for this frame (does not effect future frames)
49 inline void jo_gif_frame(jo_gif_t *gif, unsigned char *rgba, short delayCsec, bool localPalette);
50 
51 // gif | the state (returned from jo_gif_start)
52 inline void jo_gif_end(jo_gif_t *gif);

62 // Based on NeuQuant algorithm
63 inline void jo_gif_quantize(unsigned char *rgba, int rgbaSize, int sample, unsigned char *map, int numColors) {
64  // defs for freq and bias
65  const int intbiasshift = 16; /* bias for fractions */
66  const int intbias = (((int) 1) << intbiasshift);
67  const int gammashift = 10; /* gamma = 1024 */
68  const int betashift = 10;
69  const int beta = (intbias >> betashift); /* beta = 1/1024 */
70  const int betagamma = (intbias << (gammashift - betashift));
71 
72  // defs for decreasing radius factor
73  const int radiusbiasshift = 6; /* at 32.0 biased by 6 bits */
74  const int radiusbias = (((int) 1) << radiusbiasshift);
75  const int radiusdec = 30; /* factor of 1/30 each cycle */
76 
77  // defs for decreasing alpha factor
78  const int alphabiasshift = 10; /* alpha starts at 1.0 */
79  const int initalpha = (((int) 1) << alphabiasshift);
80 
81  // radbias and alpharadbias used for radpower calculation
82  const int radbiasshift = 8;
83  const int radbias = (((int) 1) << radbiasshift);
84  const int alpharadbshift = (alphabiasshift + radbiasshift);
85  const int alpharadbias = (((int) 1) << alpharadbshift);
86 
87  sample = sample < 1 ? 1 : sample > 30 ? 30 : sample;
88  int network[256][3];
89  int bias[256] = {}, freq[256];
90  for(int i = 0; i < numColors; ++i) {
91  // Put nurons evenly through the luminance spectrum.
92  network[i][0] = network[i][1] = network[i][2] = (i << 12) / numColors;
93  freq[i] = intbias / numColors;
94  }
95  // Learn
96  {
97  const int primes[5] = {499, 491, 487, 503};
98  int step = 4;
99  for(int i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
100  if(rgbaSize > primes[i] * 4 && (rgbaSize % primes[i])) { // TODO/Error? primes[i]*4?
101  step = primes[i] * 4;
102  }
103  }
104  sample = step == 4 ? 1 : sample;
105 
106  int alphadec = 30 + ((sample - 1) / 3);
107  int samplepixels = rgbaSize / (4 * sample);
108  int delta = samplepixels / 100;
109  int alpha = initalpha;
110  delta = delta == 0 ? 1 : delta;
111 
112  int radius = (numColors >> 3) * radiusbias;
113  int rad = radius >> radiusbiasshift;
114  rad = rad <= 1 ? 0 : rad;
115  int radSq = rad*rad;
116  int radpower[32];
117  for (int i = 0; i < rad; i++) {
118  radpower[i] = alpha * (((radSq - i * i) * radbias) / radSq);
119  }
120 
121  // Randomly walk through the pixels and relax neurons to the "optimal" target.
122  for(int i = 0, pix = 0; i < samplepixels;) {
123  int r = rgba[pix + 0] << 4;
124  int g = rgba[pix + 1] << 4;
125  int b = rgba[pix + 2] << 4;
126  int j = -1;
127  {
128  // finds closest neuron (min dist) and updates freq
129  // finds best neuron (min dist-bias) and returns position
130  // for frequently chosen neurons, freq[k] is high and bias[k] is negative
131  // bias[k] = gamma*((1/numColors)-freq[k])
132 
133  int bestd = 0x7FFFFFFF, bestbiasd = 0x7FFFFFFF, bestpos = -1;
134  for (int k = 0; k < numColors; k++) {
135  int *n = network[k];
136  int dist = abs(n[0] - r) + abs(n[1] - g) + abs(n[2] - b);
137  if (dist < bestd) {
138  bestd = dist;
139  bestpos = k;
140  }
141  int biasdist = dist - ((bias[k]) >> (intbiasshift - 4));
142  if (biasdist < bestbiasd) {
143  bestbiasd = biasdist;
144  j = k;
145  }
146  int betafreq = freq[k] >> betashift;
147  freq[k] -= betafreq;
148  bias[k] += betafreq << gammashift;
149  }
150  freq[bestpos] += beta;
151  bias[bestpos] -= betagamma;
152  }
153 
154  // Move neuron j towards biased (b,g,r) by factor alpha
155  network[j][0] -= (network[j][0] - r) * alpha / initalpha;
156  network[j][1] -= (network[j][1] - g) * alpha / initalpha;
157  network[j][2] -= (network[j][2] - b) * alpha / initalpha;
158  if (rad != 0) {
159  // Move adjacent neurons by precomputed alpha*(1-((i-j)^2/[r]^2)) in radpower[|i-j|]
160  int lo = j - rad;
161  lo = lo < -1 ? -1 : lo;
162  int hi = j + rad;
163  hi = hi > numColors ? numColors : hi;
164  for(int jj = j+1, m=1; jj < hi; ++jj) {
165  int a = radpower[m++];
166  network[jj][0] -= (network[jj][0] - r) * a / alpharadbias;
167  network[jj][1] -= (network[jj][1] - g) * a / alpharadbias;
168  network[jj][2] -= (network[jj][2] - b) * a / alpharadbias;
169  }
170  for(int k = j-1, m=1; k > lo; --k) {
171  int a = radpower[m++];
172  network[k][0] -= (network[k][0] - r) * a / alpharadbias;
173  network[k][1] -= (network[k][1] - g) * a / alpharadbias;
174  network[k][2] -= (network[k][2] - b) * a / alpharadbias;
175  }
176  }
177 
178  pix += step;
179  pix = pix >= rgbaSize ? pix - rgbaSize : pix;
180 
181  // every 1% of the image, move less over the following iterations.
182  if(++i % delta == 0) {
183  alpha -= alpha / alphadec;
184  radius -= radius / radiusdec;
185  rad = radius >> radiusbiasshift;
186  rad = rad <= 1 ? 0 : rad;
187  radSq = rad*rad;
188  for (j = 0; j < rad; j++) {
189  radpower[j] = alpha * ((radSq - j * j) * radbias / radSq);
190  }
191  }
192  }
193  }
194  // Unbias network to give byte values 0..255
195  for (int i = 0; i < numColors; i++) {
196  map[i*3+0] = network[i][0] >>= 4;
197  map[i*3+1] = network[i][1] >>= 4;
198  map[i*3+2] = network[i][2] >>= 4;
199  }
200 }
201 
202 typedef struct {
203  FILE *fp;
204  int numBits;
205  unsigned char buf[256];
206  unsigned char idx;
207  unsigned tmp;
208  int outBits;
209  int curBits;
210 } jo_gif_lzw_t;
211 
212 inline void jo_gif_lzw_write(jo_gif_lzw_t *s, int code) {
213  s->outBits |= code << s->curBits;
214  s->curBits += s->numBits;
215  while(s->curBits >= 8) {
216  s->buf[s->idx++] = s->outBits & 255;
217  s->outBits >>= 8;
218  s->curBits -= 8;
219  if (s->idx >= 255) {
220  putc(s->idx, s->fp);
221  fwrite(s->buf, s->idx, 1, s->fp);
222  s->idx = 0;
223  }
224  }
225 }
226 
227 inline void jo_gif_lzw_encode(unsigned char *in, int len, FILE *fp) {
228  jo_gif_lzw_t state = {fp, 9};
229  int maxcode = 511;
230 
231  // Note: 30k stack space for dictionary =|
232  const int hashSize = 5003;
233  short codetab[hashSize];
234  int hashTbl[hashSize];
235  memset(hashTbl, 0xFF, sizeof(hashTbl));
236 
237  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0x100);
238 
239  int free_ent = 0x102;
240  int ent = *in++;
241  CONTINUE:
242  while (--len) {
243  int c = *in++;
244  int fcode = (c << 12) + ent;
245  int key = (c << 4) ^ ent; // xor hashing
246  while(hashTbl[key] >= 0) {
247  if(hashTbl[key] == fcode) {
248  ent = codetab[key];
249  goto CONTINUE;
250  }
251  ++key;
252  key = key >= hashSize ? key - hashSize : key;
253  }
254  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, ent);
255  ent = c;
256  if(free_ent < 4096) {
257  if(free_ent > maxcode) {
258  ++state.numBits;
259  if(state.numBits == 12) {
260  maxcode = 4096;
261  } else {
262  maxcode = (1<<state.numBits)-1;
263  }
264  }
265  codetab[key] = free_ent++;
266  hashTbl[key] = fcode;
267  } else {
268  memset(hashTbl, 0xFF, sizeof(hashTbl));
269  free_ent = 0x102;
270  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0x100);
271  state.numBits = 9;
272  maxcode = 511;
273  }
274  }
275  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, ent);
276  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0x101);
277  jo_gif_lzw_write(&state, 0);
278  if(state.idx) {
279  putc(state.idx, fp);
280  fwrite(state.buf, state.idx, 1, fp);
281  }
282 }
283 
284 inline int jo_gif_clamp(int a, int b, int c) { return a < b ? b : a > c ? c : a; }
285 
286 jo_gif_t jo_gif_start(const char *filename, short width, short height, short repeat, int numColors) {
287  numColors = numColors > 255 ? 255 : numColors < 2 ? 2 : numColors;
288  jo_gif_t gif = {};
289  gif.width = width;
290  gif.height = height;
291  gif.repeat = repeat;
292  gif.numColors = numColors;
293  gif.palSize = log2(numColors);
294 
295  gif.fp = fopen(filename, "wb");
296  if(!gif.fp) {
297  printf("Error: Could not WriteGif to %s\n", filename);
298  return gif;
299  }
300 
301  fwrite("GIF89a", 6, 1, gif.fp);
302  // Logical Screen Descriptor
303  fwrite(&gif.width, 2, 1, gif.fp);
304  fwrite(&gif.height, 2, 1, gif.fp);
305  putc(0xF0 | gif.palSize, gif.fp);
306  fwrite("\x00\x00", 2, 1, gif.fp); // bg color index (unused), aspect ratio
307  return gif;
308 }
309 
310 inline void jo_gif_frame(jo_gif_t *gif, unsigned char * rgba, short delayCsec, bool localPalette) {
311  if(!gif->fp) {
312  return;
313  }
314  short width = gif->width;
315  short height = gif->height;
316  int size = width * height;
317 
318  unsigned char localPalTbl[0x300];
319  unsigned char *palette = gif->frame == 0 || !localPalette ? gif->palette : localPalTbl;
320  if(gif->frame == 0 || localPalette) {
321  jo_gif_quantize(rgba, size*4, 1, palette, gif->numColors);
322  }
323 
324  unsigned char *indexedPixels = (unsigned char *)malloc(size);
325  {
326  unsigned char *ditheredPixels = (unsigned char*)malloc(size*4);
327  memcpy(ditheredPixels, rgba, size*4);
328  for(int k = 0; k < size*4; k+=4) {
329  int rgb[3] = { ditheredPixels[k+0], ditheredPixels[k+1], ditheredPixels[k+2] };
330  int bestd = 0x7FFFFFFF, best = -1;
331  // TODO: exhaustive search. do something better.
332  for(int i = 0; i < gif->numColors; ++i) {
333  int bb = palette[i*3+0]-rgb[0];
334  int gg = palette[i*3+1]-rgb[1];
335  int rr = palette[i*3+2]-rgb[2];
336  int d = bb*bb + gg*gg + rr*rr;
337  if(d < bestd) {
338  bestd = d;
339  best = i;
340  }
341  }
342  indexedPixels[k/4] = best;
343  int diff[3] = { ditheredPixels[k+0] - palette[indexedPixels[k/4]*3+0], ditheredPixels[k+1] - palette[indexedPixels[k/4]*3+1], ditheredPixels[k+2] - palette[indexedPixels[k/4]*3+2] };
344  // Floyd-Steinberg Error Diffusion
345  // TODO: Use something better -- http://caca.zoy.org/study/part3.html
346  if(k+4 < size*4) {
347  ditheredPixels[k+4+0] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+4+0]+(diff[0]*7/16), 0, 255);
348  ditheredPixels[k+4+1] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+4+1]+(diff[1]*7/16), 0, 255);
349  ditheredPixels[k+4+2] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+4+2]+(diff[2]*7/16), 0, 255);
350  }
351  if(k+width*4+4 < size*4) {
352  for(int i = 0; i < 3; ++i) {
353  ditheredPixels[k-4+width*4+i] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k-4+width*4+i]+(diff[i]*3/16), 0, 255);
354  ditheredPixels[k+width*4+i] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+width*4+i]+(diff[i]*5/16), 0, 255);
355  ditheredPixels[k+width*4+4+i] = (unsigned char)jo_gif_clamp(ditheredPixels[k+width*4+4+i]+(diff[i]*1/16), 0, 255);
356  }
357  }
358  }
359  free(ditheredPixels);
360  }
361  if(gif->frame == 0) {
362  // Global Color Table
363  fwrite(palette, 3*(1<<(gif->palSize+1)), 1, gif->fp);
364  if(gif->repeat >= 0) {
365  // Netscape Extension
366  fwrite("\x21\xff\x0bNETSCAPE2.0\x03\x01", 16, 1, gif->fp);
367  fwrite(&gif->repeat, 2, 1, gif->fp); // loop count (extra iterations, 0=repeat forever)
368  putc(0, gif->fp); // block terminator
369  }
370  }
371  // Graphic Control Extension
372  fwrite("\x21\xf9\x04\x00", 4, 1, gif->fp);
373  fwrite(&delayCsec, 2, 1, gif->fp); // delayCsec x 1/100 sec
374  fwrite("\x00\x00", 2, 1, gif->fp); // transparent color index (first byte), currently unused
375  // Image Descriptor
376  fwrite("\x2c\x00\x00\x00\x00", 5, 1, gif->fp); // header, x,y
377  fwrite(&width, 2, 1, gif->fp);
378  fwrite(&height, 2, 1, gif->fp);
379  if (gif->frame == 0 || !localPalette) {
380  putc(0, gif->fp);
381  } else {
382  putc(0x80|gif->palSize, gif->fp );
383  fwrite(palette, 3*(1<<(gif->palSize+1)), 1, gif->fp);
384  }
385  putc(8, gif->fp); // block terminator
386  jo_gif_lzw_encode(indexedPixels, size, gif->fp);
387  putc(0, gif->fp); // block terminator
388  ++gif->frame;
389  free(indexedPixels);
390 }
391 
392 inline void jo_gif_end(jo_gif_t *gif) {
393  if(!gif->fp) {
394  return;
395  }
396  putc(0x3b, gif->fp); // gif trailer
397  fclose(gif->fp);
398 }

511 //See https://github.com/mvorbrodt/blog/blob/master/src/base64.hpp for original source.
512 //The below has been modified to use unsigned characters to avoid signed->unsigned->signed fiddling.
513 namespace base64{
514  static constexpr unsigned char kEncodeLookup[] = "ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZabcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz0123456789+/";
515  static constexpr unsigned char kPadCharacter = '=';
516 
523  inline std::string encode(const std::vector<unsigned char>& input)
524  {
525  std::stringstream encoded;
526  std::uint32_t temp{};
527 
528  auto it = input.begin();
529 
530  for(std::size_t i = 0; i < input.size() / 3; ++i)
531  {
532  temp = (*it++) << 16;
533  temp += (*it++) << 8;
534  temp += (*it++);
535  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00FC0000) >> 18];
536  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0003F000) >> 12];
537  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00000FC0) >> 6 ];
538  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0000003F) ];
539  }
540 
541  switch(input.size() % 3)
542  {
543  case 1:
544  temp = (*it++) << 16;
545  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00FC0000) >> 18];
546  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0003F000) >> 12];
547  encoded << kPadCharacter << kPadCharacter;
548  break;
549  case 2:
550  temp = (*it++) << 16;
551  temp += (*it++) << 8;
552  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00FC0000) >> 18];
553  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x0003F000) >> 12];
554  encoded << kEncodeLookup[(temp & 0x00000FC0) >> 6 ];
555  encoded << kPadCharacter;
556  break;
557  }
558 
559  return encoded.str();
560  }
561 }

574  typedef uint32_t color_int_t; //Alpha value is extra, serves as padding

576 
584  inline constexpr color_int_t resolveColorInt(uint8_t r, uint8_t g, uint8_t b) {
585  return ((r & 0xFF) << 16) + ((g & 0xFF) << 8) + (b & 0xFF);
586  }
587 
593  inline void resolveColorComp(color_int_t pack, uint8_t& r, uint8_t& g, uint8_t& b) {
594  r = (pack & 0x00FF0000) >> 16; //Red
595  g = (pack & 0x0000FF00) >> 8; //Green
596  b = (pack & 0x000000FF); // >> 0; //Blue
597  }
598 
603  inline time_t epochTime() {
604  return std::chrono::system_clock::now().time_since_epoch() / std::chrono::milliseconds(1);
605  }
606 
609  inline void sleep(long ms) {
610  if (ms <= 0)
611  return;
612  std::this_thread::sleep_for(std::chrono::milliseconds(ms));
613  }

1370 
1379  class Color {
1380  public:
1381  typedef uint8_t component_t;
1382 
1383  union {
1384  struct {
1385  component_t r;
1386  component_t g;
1387  component_t b;
1388  };
1389  component_t components[3];
1390  };
1391 
1392  Color(detail::color_int_t packedColor) {
1393  detail::resolveColorComp(packedColor, r, g, b);
1394  }
1395 
1396  /*\brief Color constructor for unsigned 8-bit RGB values.
1397  \param r Red component.
1398  \param g Green component.
1399  \param b Blue component.*/
1400  Color(component_t r, component_t g, component_t b) :
1401  r(r), g(g), b(b) {
1402  };
1403 
1404  /*\brief Copy constructor.
1405  \param other Constant reference to other instance of a color object.*/
1406  Color(const Color& other) :
1407  r(other.r), g(other.g), b(other.b) {
1408  }
1409 
1410  /*\brief Name constructor.
1411  Takes a literal color name as an input.
1412  \param name The name of the color from which to derive value.
1413  \sa fromName()*/
1414  Color(const std::string& name);
1415 
1416  /*\brief Default constructor.
1417  Initializes this color to white. (all components 255)*/
1418  Color() {
1419  r = g = b = 255;
1420  }
1421 
1422  Color& operator=(detail::color_int_t pack) {
1423  detail::resolveColorComp(pack, r, g, b);
1424  return *this;
1425  }
1426 
1430  const component_t * const rgbPtr() const {
1431  return &components[0];
1432  }
1433 
1436  void assignAt(component_t* dest) const {
1437  dest[0] = r;
1438  dest[1] = g;
1439  dest[2] = b;
1440  }
1441  };

2546  struct ivec2 {
2547  union{
2548  struct{
2549  int x, y;
2550  };
2551  int data[2];
2552  };
2553 
2555  ivec2() : x(0), y(0){}
2556 
2560  ivec2(int x, int y) : x(x), y(y) {}
2561 
2562  /*Array access operator overload.*/
2563 
2567  inline int& operator[](int index){
2568  return data[index];
2569  }
2570 
2574  inline int operator[](int index) const{
2575  return data[index];
2576  }
2577 
2578  ivec2 operator+(const ivec2& other) const{
2579  return {x + other.x, y + other.y};
2580  }
2581 
2582  ivec2& operator+=(const ivec2& other){
2583  x += other.x;
2584  y += other.y;
2585  return *this;
2586  }
2587 
2588  ivec2 operator-(const ivec2& other) const{
2589  return {x - other.x, y - other.y};
2590  }
2591 
2592  ivec2& operator-=(const ivec2& other){
2593  x -= other.x;
2594  y -= other.y;
2595  return *this;
2596  }
2597 
2599  bool operator==(const ivec2& other){
2600  return x == other.x && y == other.y;
2601  }
2602  };
2603 
2608  inline int distance(const ivec2& a, const ivec2& b) {
2609  return static_cast<int>(std::sqrt(std::pow(b.x - a.x, 2) + std::pow(b.y - a.y, 2)));
2610  }
2611 
2616  inline ivec2 middle(const ivec2& a, const ivec2& b) {
2617  return ivec2((a.x + b.x) / 2, (a.y + b.y) / 2);
2618  }
2619 
2626  inline ivec2 lerp(const ivec2& a, const ivec2& b, float progress){
2627  if (progress <= 0)
2628  return a;
2629  else if (progress >= 1)
2630  return b;
2631  return {
2632  static_cast<int>(std::round(progress * (b.x - a.x))) + a.x,
2633  static_cast<int>(std::round(progress * (b.y - a.y))) + a.y
2634  };
2635  }
2636 
2638  typedef ivec2 Point;
2639 
2651  inline void drawLine(Image& imgRef, int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2, Color c, int width = 1) {
2652  width = std::clamp(width, 1, 100);//clamp the line width to avoid wobbly lines...
2653  if(x1 == x2 && y1 == y2)
2654  return;
2655  else if (width == 1) {
2656  //Just use the built-in bresenham line function
2657  //to draw line with widths of 1.
2658  imgRef.draw_line(x1, y1, x2, y2, c.rgbPtr());
2659  return;
2660  }
2661 
2662  //Simplified this a bit. Might be a little bit faster.
2663  //Old implementation was bresenham with a circle at every point.
2664  //now, this algorithm considers the radius of each circle it will blit
2665  //while traversing the line. Uses linear interpolation between two points.
2666  //This should reduce the total number of blits on thicker lines.
2667  //Consider a line with a width of 50; the radius for the circles would be
2668  //25. We blit every one-third of the radius minus one, so a line that's 100 units long, for example,
2669  //would get a circle around every 7 pixels. That's roughly 14-15 circles. Compared to the 100 circles
2670  //it used to take, that's a considerable improvement.
2671  //Creates wobbly lines at high thicknesses; thus, width is now confined to a range.
2672  const ivec2 a = {x1,y1};
2673  const ivec2 b = {x2,y2};
2674  const int dist = distance(a, b);//distance to bound the lerp by.
2675  const int radius = width / 2; //integer division... be mindful.
2676  const int progression = std::max((radius/3)-1, 1); // division by 3 was an arbitrary choice, but yields good results
2677  for(int i = 0; i < dist + progression; i += progression){ // progress by radius
2678  const ivec2 position = lerp(a, b, float(i) / float(dist));
2679  imgRef.draw_circle(position.x, position.y, radius, c.rgbPtr());
2680  }
2681  }
2682 
2689  class Transform {
2690  public:
2693  Transform() {
2694  identity();
2695  }
2696 
2699  Transform(const Transform& other)
2700  : value(other.value), rotation(other.rotation) {
2701  }
2702 
2709  Transform& identity() {
2710  value.fill(0.0f);
2711  at(0, 0) = at(1, 1) = 1.0f;
2712  rotation = 0;
2713  return *this;
2714  }
2715 
2718  bool operator==(const Transform& other) const {
2719  bool eq = true;
2720  for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
2721  if (value[i] != other.value[i]) {
2722  eq = false;
2723  break;
2724  }
2725  }
2726  return eq;
2727  }
2728 
2731  float getScaleX() const {
2732  return at(0, 0);
2733  }
2734 
2737  float getScaleY() const {
2738  return at(1, 1);
2739  }
2740 
2743  float getTranslateX() const {
2744  return at(0, 2);
2745  }
2746 
2749  float getTranslateY() const {
2750  return at(1, 2);
2751  }
2752 
2755  float getRotation() const {
2756  return rotation;
2757  }
2758 
2760  Transform& forward(float distance) {
2761  //Adding the round here fixed rounding issues!
2762  at(0, 2) += std::round(std::cos(rotation) * distance); //x component
2763  at(1, 2) += std::round(std::sin(rotation) * distance); //y component
2764  return *this;
2765  }
2766 
2767  /*Backwards inline function.
2768  Just negates the input of a forward function call.*/
2769  inline Transform& backward(float distance) {
2770  return forward(-distance);
2771  }
2772 
2777  Transform& setTranslation(int x, int y) {
2778  at(0, 2) = static_cast<float>(x);
2779  at(1, 2) = static_cast<float>(y);
2780  return *this;
2781  }
2782 
2785  Point getTranslation() const {
2786  return Point((int) at(0, 2), (int) at(1, 2));
2787  }
2788 
2792  Transform& setTranslationX(int x) {
2793  at(0, 2) = static_cast<float>(x);
2794  return *this;
2795  }
2796 
2800  Transform& setTranslationY(int y) {
2801  at(1, 2) = static_cast<float>(y);
2802  return *this;
2803  }
2804 
2809  Transform& translate(int x, int y) {
2810  at(0, 2) += static_cast<float>(x) * at(0, 0) + static_cast<float>(y) * at(0, 1);
2811  at(1, 2) += static_cast<float>(x) * at(1, 0) + static_cast<float>(y) * at(1, 1);
2812  return *this;
2813  }
2814 
2818  Transform& rotate(float theta) {
2819  //6.28319 is a full rotation in radians. (360 degrees)
2820  constexpr float fullcircle = 6.28319f;
2821 
2822  //Much smarter solution than recursive spinning.
2823  //Takes the modulus between what would have been the pre-fix result
2824  //and a full circle, and subtracts the original rotation.
2825  //This gives pretty accurate rotations rather quickly.
2826  //No recursive spinning required! :)
2827  const float origResult = rotation + theta;
2828  if (origResult > fullcircle || origResult < 0)
2829  theta = std::fmod(origResult, fullcircle) - rotation;
2830 
2831  const float c = std::cos(theta);
2832  const float s = std::sin(theta);
2833 
2834  const float new00 = at(0, 0) * c + at(0, 1) * s;
2835  const float new01 = at(0, 0) * -s + at(0, 1) * c;
2836  const float new10 = at(1, 0) * c + at(1, 1) * s;
2837  const float new11 = at(1, 0) * -s + at(1, 1) * c;
2838 
2839  at(0, 0) = new00;//x
2840  at(0, 1) = new01;//y
2841  at(1, 0) = new10;//rotX
2842  at(1, 1) = new11;//rotY
2843 
2844  rotation += theta;
2845 
2846  return *this;
2847  }
2848 
2852  Transform& setRotation(float val) {
2853  if (val == rotation)
2854  return *this;
2855  if (rotation != 0.0f)
2856  rotate(-rotation);
2857  rotate(val);
2858  return *this;
2859  }
2860 
2866  Transform& rotateAround(int x, int y, float theta) {
2867  translate(x, y);
2868  rotate(theta);
2869  translate(-x, -y);
2870  return *this;
2871  }
2872 
2876  Transform& scale(float sx, float sy) {
2877  at(0, 0) *= sx;
2878  at(0, 1) *= sy;
2879  at(1, 0) *= sx;
2880  at(1, 1) *= sy;
2881  return *this;
2882  }
2883 
2887  Transform& concatenate(const Transform& t) {
2888  const float new00 = at(0, 0) * t.at(0, 0) + at(0, 1) * t.at(1, 0);
2889  const float new01 = at(0, 0) * t.at(0, 1) + at(0, 1) * t.at(1, 1);
2890  const float new02 = at(0, 0) * t.at(0, 2) + at(0, 1) * t.at(1, 2) + at(0, 2);
2891  const float new10 = at(1, 0) * t.at(0, 0) + at(1, 1) * t.at(1, 0);
2892  const float new11 = at(1, 0) * t.at(0, 1) + at(1, 1) * t.at(1, 1);
2893  const float new12 = at(1, 0) * t.at(0, 2) + at(1, 1) * t.at(1, 2) + at(1, 2);
2894 
2895  at(0, 0) = new00;
2896  at(0, 1) = new01;
2897  at(0, 2) = new02;
2898  at(1, 0) = new10;
2899  at(1, 1) = new11;
2900  at(1, 2) = new12;
2901  rotation += t.rotation;
2902  return *this;
2903  }
2904 
2908  Transform copyConcatenate(const Transform& t) const {
2909  Transform copy;
2910  copy.assign(*this);
2911  copy.concatenate(t);
2912  return copy;
2913  }
2914 
2920  Transform lerp(const Transform& t, float progress) const {
2921  if (progress <= 0)
2922  return *this;
2923  else if (progress >= 1)
2924  return t;
2925  Transform result;
2926  for (int i = 0; i < 9; i++) {
2927  result.value[i] = (progress * (t.value[i] - value[i])) + value[i];
2928  }
2929  return result;
2930  }
2931 
2934  void assign(const Transform& t) {
2935  value = t.value;
2936  rotation = t.rotation;
2937  }
2938 
2944  Point transform(Point in, Point* dst = nullptr) const {
2945  Point temp;
2946  Point* dstPtr = (dst == nullptr) ? &temp : dst;
2947 
2948  dstPtr->x = static_cast<int>(
2949  at(0, 0) * (static_cast<float>(in.x)) +
2950  at(0, 1) * (static_cast<float>(in.y)) + at(0, 2));
2951  dstPtr->y = static_cast<int>(
2952  at(1, 0) * (static_cast<float>(in.x)) +
2953  at(1, 1) * (static_cast<float>(in.y)) + at(1, 2));
2954 
2955  return *dstPtr;
2956  }
2957 
2961  template<typename ITER_T>
2962  void transformSet(ITER_T cur, ITER_T end) const {
2963  while (cur != end) {
2964  transform(&(*cur), &(*cur));
2965  cur++;
2966  }
2967  }
2968 
2969  /*Operator overload to transform a single point, for convenience.*/
2970 
2973  inline Point operator()(Point in) const {
2974  return transform(in);
2975  }

2980  typedef std::array<float, 9> mat_t;
2981 
2983  mat_t value;
2984 
2986  float rotation = 0;
2987 
2991  inline float& at(int row, int col) {
2992  return value[row * 3 + col];
2993  }
2994 
2998  float at(int row, int col) const {
2999  return value[row * 3 + col];
3000  }
3001  };

3028  class BitmapFont{
3029  public:
3038  BitmapFont(const Image& img, int asciiOffs, int glyphWidth, int glyphHeight, int glyphsX, int glyphsY)
3039  : asciiOffset(asciiOffs),
3040  glyphWidth(glyphWidth), glyphHeight(glyphHeight),
3041  glyphsX(glyphsX), glyphsY(glyphsY){
3042 
3043  //fill the glyphs vector...
3044  const ivec2 glyphSz = {glyphWidth, glyphHeight};
3045 
3046  for(unsigned char c = static_cast<char>(asciiOffset); c < UINT8_MAX; c++){
3047  const ivec2 min = getGlyphPosition(c);
3048  const ivec2 max = (min + glyphSz) - ivec2(1, 1);
3049  glyphs.push_back(img.get_crop(
3050  min.x, min.y,
3051  max.x, max.y));
3052  }
3053  }
3054 
3059  const Image& getGlyphImage(unsigned char c) const{
3060  return glyphs.at(c - asciiOffset);
3061  }
3062 
3067  inline const Image& operator[](unsigned char c) const{
3068  return getGlyphImage(c);
3069  }
3070 
3076  ivec2 getGlyphPosition(unsigned char c) const{
3077  return {((c - asciiOffset) % glyphsX) * glyphWidth,
3078  (static_cast<int>(std::floor(float(c - asciiOffset) / (float)glyphsX))) * glyphHeight
3079  };
3080  }
3081 
3086  ivec2 getGlyphExtent() const{
3087  return {glyphWidth, glyphHeight};
3088  }
3089 
3093  int getTotalGlyphs() const{
3094  return glyphsX * glyphsY;
3095  }
3096 
3100  bool isValid(char c) const{
3101  return 255 > (c - asciiOffset) > -1;
3102  }
3103 
3108  ivec2 getGlyphAxes() const{
3109  return {glyphsX, glyphsY};
3110  }
3111  private:
3112  std::vector<Image> glyphs;
3113  int asciiOffset, glyphWidth, glyphHeight, glyphsX, glyphsY;
3114  };

3169  class Text : public AbstractDrawableObject {
3170  public:
3172  const std::string text;
3173  const BitmapFont& font;
3174  TextAlign alignment;
3175  float scale;
3176 
3177  Text(const std::string& text, const BitmapFont& font, Color color, float scale = 1.0f, TextAlign alignment = TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT)
3178  : text(text), font(font), scale(scale), alignment(alignment){
3179  fillColor = color;
3180  }
3181 
3182  Text(const Text& copy)
3183  : text(copy.text), font(copy.font), scale(copy.scale), alignment(copy.alignment){
3184  fillColor = copy.fillColor;
3185  }
3186 
3187  AbstractDrawableObject* copy() const{
3188  return new Text(*this);
3189  }
3190 
3191  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const{
3192  //keep track of the length of the longest line of text...
3193  int longestLine = 0;
3194 
3195  //First, split the text into lines.
3196  std::string temp;
3197  std::list<std::string> textLines;
3198  std::stringstream ss(text);
3199  while(std::getline(ss, temp, '\n')){
3200  longestLine = std::max(longestLine, static_cast<int>(temp.size()));
3201  textLines.push_back(temp);
3202  }
3203 
3204  //From there we can get some basic metrics.
3205  const ivec2 glyphSz = font.getGlyphExtent();//the size of a single glyph
3206  const int lines = textLines.size();//the total number of lines of text
3207  const int strPixLen = glyphSz.x * longestLine;//the length, in pixels, of the longest line of text
3208 
3209  //Create the temporary image.
3210  //we double the temp image size to get a proper final rotation.
3211  Image textImage(strPixLen * 2, (glyphSz.y * lines) * 2);
3212  textImage.channels(0, 3);//force RGBA on temp image
3213 
3214  int line = 0;
3215  //blit each character into the temporary image
3216 
3217  auto lineIter = textLines.begin();
3218  while(lineIter != textLines.end()){
3219  const std::string& text = *lineIter;
3220 
3221  //text alignment with some relatively simple maths.
3222  int hOffset = 0;
3223 
3224  switch(alignment){
3225  case TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT:
3226  break;//left align left needs no horizontal offset...
3227  case TEXT_ALIGN_RIGHT:
3228  hOffset = strPixLen - (text.size() * glyphSz.x);
3229  break;
3230  case TEXT_ALIGN_CENTER:
3231  hOffset = (strPixLen / 2) - ((text.size() * glyphSz.x) / 2);
3232  break;
3233  }
3234 
3235  for(int i = 0; i < text.size(); i++) {
3236  const char curChar = text[i];
3237  if(curChar == ' ' || !font.isValid(curChar))//skip space or out-of-range characters...
3238  continue;
3239 
3240  const Image& tempGlyph = font[curChar];
3241  const ivec2 destPosition = {strPixLen + hOffset + (i * glyphSz.x), line * glyphSz.y};
3242  textImage.draw_image(destPosition.x, destPosition.y,
3243  tempGlyph);
3244 
3245  //Apply the fill color with a multiplication filter for the size of each glyph.
3246  //for each pixel in the previously written glyph, multiply its color...
3247  for(int y = destPosition.y; y < destPosition.y + tempGlyph.height(); y++)
3248  for(int x = destPosition.x; x < destPosition.x + tempGlyph.width(); x++)
3249  for(int c = 0; c < 3; c++)
3250  textImage(x,y,c) *= (fillColor.components[c] / float(UINT8_MAX));
3251  }
3252 
3253  lineIter++;
3254  line++;
3255  }
3256 
3257  //resize image according to scale
3258  textImage.resize(static_cast<int>(std::round(textImage.width() * scale)),
3259  static_cast<int>(std::round(textImage.height() * scale)));
3260 
3261  //rotate the image with nearest-neighbor interpolation
3262  textImage.rotate(-toDegrees(t.getRotation()), 1, 0);
3263 
3264  //draw the image centered
3265  //rotating a doubly-sized image makes the origin of the rotation essentially halfway through the image
3266  //therefore, to draw at the proper location, we need to center it relative to the transform location.
3267  imgRef.draw_image(
3268  t.getTranslateX() - (textImage.width() / 2),
3269  t.getTranslateY() - (textImage.height() / 2),
3270  textImage, textImage.get_shared_channel(3), 1, 255);
3271  }
3272 
3273  ~Text(){}
3274  };

3324  class Circle : public AbstractDrawableObject {
3325  public:
3327  int radius = 10;
3330  int steps = 10;
3331 
3333  Circle() {
3334  }
3335 
3339  Circle(int radius, int steps, Color fillColor, int outlineWidth = 0, Color outlineColor = Color())
3340  : radius(radius), steps(steps){
3341  this->fillColor = fillColor;
3342  this->outlineWidth = outlineWidth;
3343  this->outlineColor = outlineColor;
3344  }
3345 
3348  Circle(const Circle& other)
3349  : radius(other.radius), steps(other.steps){
3350  this->fillColor = fillColor;
3351  this->outlineWidth = outlineWidth;
3352  this->outlineColor = outlineColor;
3353  }
3354

3356  return new Circle(*this);
3357  }
3358 
3359  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const{
3360  if (steps <= 0)
3361  return; //no step check
3362  cimg::CImg<int> passPts(steps, 2);
3363 
3364  for (int i = 0; i < steps; i++) {
3365  Point p;
3366  p.x = int(radius * std::cos(i * (2 * M_PI) / steps));
3367  p.y = int(radius * std::sin(i * (2 * M_PI) / steps));
3368  Point tPoint = t(p);
3369  passPts(i, 0) = tPoint.x;
3370  passPts(i, 1) = tPoint.y;
3371  }
3372 
3373  imgRef.draw_polygon(passPts, fillColor.rgbPtr());
3374 
3375  if (outlineWidth > 0) {//draw outline using previously generated points.
3376  //LineLoop impl
3377  for (int i = 1; i < steps; i++) {
3378  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(i - 1, 0), passPts(i - 1, 1), passPts(i, 0), passPts(i, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3379  }
3380  //draw last line between first and last
3381  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(steps - 1, 0), passPts(steps - 1, 1), passPts(0, 0), passPts(0, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3382  }
3383  }
3384  };

3436  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const{
3437  if (points.empty())
3438  return;
3439  /*CImg requires all polygons to be passed in as an instance of
3440  the image object. Therefore, we can specify an "int" image with
3441  a width of 2 (x,y) and height of the total number of
3442  elements in the point vector.*/
3443  cimg::CImg<int> passPts(static_cast<int>(points.size()), 2);
3444 
3445  for (int i = 0; i < points.size(); i++) {
3446  const Point pt = t(points[i]);
3447  passPts(i, 0) = pt.x;
3448  passPts(i, 1) = pt.y;
3449  }
3450 
3451  imgRef.draw_polygon(passPts, fillColor.rgbPtr());
3452 
3453  if (outlineWidth > 0) {//draw outline using previously generated points.
3454  //LineLoop impl
3455  for (int i = 1; i < points.size(); i++) {
3456  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(i - 1, 0), passPts(i - 1, 1), passPts(i, 0), passPts(i, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3457  }
3458  //draw last line between first and last
3459  drawLine(imgRef, passPts(int(points.size()) - 1, 0), passPts(int(points.size()) - 1, 1), passPts(0, 0), passPts(0, 1), outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3460  }
3461  }

3507  void draw(const Transform& t, Image& imgRef) const {
3508  //Vertex order is as follows for the constructed quad.
3509  // 0--3 3
3510  // | / /|
3511  // |/ / |
3512  // 1 1--2
3513 
3514  const int halfW = drawWidth / 2;
3515  const int halfH = drawHeight / 2;
3516 
3517  Point destPoints[4] = {
3518  {-halfW, halfH}, //0
3519  {-halfW, -halfH}, //1
3520  {halfW, -halfH}, //2
3521  {halfW, halfH} //3
3522  };
3523 
3524  Point texturePoints[4] = {
3525  {srcX, srcY},
3526  {srcX, srcY + srcH},
3527  {srcX + srcW, srcY},
3528  {srcX + srcW, srcY + srcH}
3529  };
3530 
3532  for (int i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
3533  destPoints[i] = t(destPoints[i]);
3534  }
3535 
3536  //Yes, I know this isn't particularly readable.
3537  //But its purpose is described in an above commented illustration.
3538  imgRef.draw_triangle(destPoints[0][0], destPoints[0][1], destPoints[1][0], destPoints[1][1], destPoints[3][0], destPoints[3][1],
3539  spriteImg, texturePoints[0][0], texturePoints[0][1], texturePoints[1][0], texturePoints[1][1], texturePoints[3][0], texturePoints[3][1]);
3540  imgRef.draw_triangle(destPoints[1][0], destPoints[1][1], destPoints[2][0], destPoints[2][1], destPoints[3][0], destPoints[3][1],
3541  spriteImg, texturePoints[1][0], texturePoints[1][1], texturePoints[2][0], texturePoints[2][1], texturePoints[3][0], texturePoints[3][1]);
3542 
3543  if (outlineWidth > 0) {//draw outline using previously generated points.
3544  //LineLoop impl
3545  for (int i = 1; i < 4; i++) {
3546  drawLine(imgRef, destPoints[i - 1][0], destPoints[i - 1][1], destPoints[i][0], destPoints[i][1], outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3547  }
3548  //draw last line between first and last
3549  drawLine(imgRef, destPoints[3][0], destPoints[3][1], destPoints[0][0], destPoints[0][1], outlineColor, outlineWidth);
3550  }
3551  }
3552  protected:
3553  Image& spriteImg;
3554  };

3871  Image decodeDefaultFont() const{
3872  Image img(DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS_WIDTH, DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS_HEIGHT);
3873  img.channels(0, 3);//force RGBA
3874  for(int pixId = 0; pixId < DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS_LEN; pixId++){
3875  const unsigned int decodeVal = DEFAULT_FONT_PIXELS[pixId];
3876  // 8 integers per row of pixels (8*32=256)
3877  const int pixY = pixId / 8;
3878  const int pixOffsX = (pixId % 8) * 32;//offset of every pixel for the current integer.
3879  for(int i = 0; i < 32; i++){ // for every bit in the unsigned integer...
3880  const int pixX = pixOffsX + (31 - i);//31 due to number of bits in unsigned int...
3881  //get i'th pixel in the integer by bitmask and multiply
3882  const uint8_t pixel = ((decodeVal >> i) & 1) * 255;
3883  for(int c = 0; c < 4; c++)
3884  img(pixX, pixY, 0, c) = pixel;
3885  }
3886  }
3887  return img;
3888  }

4157  float towards(int x, int y){
4158  float amt = std::atan2(static_cast<float>(y) - transform->getTranslateY(), static_cast<float>(x) - transform->getTranslateX());
4159 
4160  //6.28319 is a full rotation in radians...
4161  if(toDegrees(amt) < 0)
4162  amt = 6.28319f + amt;
4163 
4164  //convert to degrees if necessary.
4165  amt = state->angleMode ? amt : toDegrees(amt);
4166  return amt + heading();
4167  }

4225  void fill(bool val){
4226  if(state->filling && !val) {
4227  //Add the fill polygon
4228  screen->getScene().emplace_back(new Polygon(fillAccum.points, state->fillColor), Transform());
4229  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end(), 1));
4230 
4231  //Add all trace lines created when tracing out the fill polygon.
4232  if(!fillLines.empty()) {
4233  //for each line we've created when having the pen down, and have been tracing a shape
4234  for(Line& lineInfo : fillLines) {
4235  screen->getScene().emplace_back(lineInfo.copy(), Transform());
4236  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end(), 1));
4237  }
4238  fillLines.clear();
4239  }
4240 
4241  fillAccum.points.clear();
4242  updateParent(false, false);
4243  }
4244  state->filling = val;
4245  }

4312  void clearstamp(int stampid){
4313  auto iter = objects.begin(); //iterator which holds an iterator to the screen's scene list.
4314 
4315  while (iter != objects.end()) {
4316  auto& objIter = *iter;
4317  if (objIter->stamp && objIter->stampid == stampid) {
4318  break;
4319  }
4320  iter++;
4321  }
4322 
4323  if (iter != objects.end()) {
4324  objects.erase(iter);
4325 
4326  if (screen != nullptr) {
4327  screen->getScene().erase(*iter);
4328  }
4329  }
4330 
4331  updateParent(true,false);
4332  }
4333 
4336  void clearstamps(int stampid = -1){
4337  typedef decltype(objects.begin()) iter_t;
4338 
4339  std::list<iter_t> removals;
4340 
4341  iter_t iter = objects.begin();
4342  while (iter != objects.end()) {
4343  auto& objIter = *iter;
4344  if (stampid < 0 ? objIter->stamp : (objIter->stamp && objIter->stampid <= stampid)) {
4345  removals.push_back(iter);
4346  }
4347  iter++;
4348  }
4349 
4350  for (iter_t& iter : removals) {
4351  screen->getScene().erase(*iter);
4352  objects.erase(iter);
4353  }
4354 
4355  updateParent(true, false);
4356  }

4380  bool undo(bool try_redraw = true){
4381  //total objects on the state stack prior to
4382  const unsigned long int totalBefore = state->objectsBefore;
4383 
4384  if (stateStack.size() >= 2)
4385  travelBack(); //Travel back if stack size >= 2
4386 
4387  //If we can't pop the state, break early.
4388  if (!popState()) {
4389  return false;
4390  }
4391 
4392  auto begin = std::prev(objects.end(), (totalBefore - state->objectsBefore));
4393  auto iter = begin;
4394 
4395  while (iter != objects.end()) {
4396  screen->getScene().erase(*iter);
4397  iter++;
4398  }
4399 
4400  objects.erase(begin, objects.end());
4401 
4402  //Will invalidate the whole screen due to object removal, but we allow the option to not.
4403  updateParent(try_redraw, false);
4404  return true;
4405  }

4409  void setundobuffer(unsigned int size) {
4410  if (size < 1)//clamp lower bound to 1
4411  size = 1;
4412 
4413  undoStackSize = size;
4414  while (stateStack.size() > size) {
4415  stateStack.pop_front();
4416  }
4417  }

4520  void draw(const Transform& screenTransform, Image& canvas){
4521  if (this->screen == nullptr)
4522  return;
4523 
4524  if (!state->visible)
4525  return;
4526 
4527  //Draw all lines queued during filling a shape.
4528  //This is only populated when the turtle moves between a beginfill
4529  //and endfill while the pen is down.
4530  for (const Line& line : fillLines)
4531  line.draw(screenTransform, canvas);
4532 
4533  if (traveling && state->tracing) {
4534  //Draw the "Travel-Line" when in the middle of the travelTo func
4535  travelPoints[0] = screenTransform(travelPoints[0]);
4536  travelPoints[1] = screenTransform(travelPoints[1]);
4537  drawLine(canvas, travelPoints[0].x, travelPoints[0].y, travelPoints[1].x, travelPoints[1].y, state->penColor, state->penWidth);
4538  }
4539 
4540  //Add the extra rotate to start cursor facing right :)
4541  const float cursorRot = this->screen->mode() == SM_STANDARD ? 1.5708f : -3.1416f;
4542  Transform cursorTransform = screenTransform.copyConcatenate(*transform).rotate(cursorRot + state->cursorTilt);
4543  state->cursor->fillColor = state->fillColor;
4544  state->cursor->outlineWidth = 1;
4545  state->cursor->outlineColor = state->penColor;
4546  state->cursor->draw(cursorTransform, canvas);
4547  }

4566  void reset(){
4567  //Reset objects, transforms, trace lines, state, etc.
4568 
4569  //Note to self, clearing the list, appending a new transform,
4570  //then reassigning the transform reference just didn't want to work.
4571  //I have no idea why. Therefore, we're resetting it in the same
4572  //manner we initially construct it.
4573  stateStack = {PenState()};
4574  state = &stateStack.back();
4575 
4576  transform = &state->transform;
4577  const auto numItems = objects.size();
4578 
4579  if (screen != nullptr) {
4580  //Re-assign cursor on reset, derived from parent screen.
4581  state->cursor.reset(screen->shape("indented triangle").copy());
4582  //Erase all objects
4583  while (!objects.empty()) {
4584  screen->getScene().erase(objects.front());
4585  objects.pop_front();
4586  }
4587 
4588  //Alter cursor tilt and default transform
4589  //when operating under SM_LOGO mode.
4590  //This is to bring it up-to-par with Python's
4591  //implementation of screen modes.
4592  //I can't decide if this solution is too "hacky" or not;
4593  //it solves the problem, but I could have done it differently.
4594  if (screen->mode() == SM_LOGO) {
4595  state->cursorTilt = (-1.5708f);
4596  transform->rotate(1.5708f);
4597  }
4598  }
4599 
4600  updateParent(numItems > 0, false);
4601  }

4609  virtual ~Turtle() {}
4610  protected:
4611  //a list of iterators that point to the parent screen's scene list.
4612  //this list is in-order as they are created by this instance.
4613  std::list<std::list<SceneObject>::iterator> objects;
4614  //the pen-state stack is, as its name might imply, the previous states
4615  //of the pen owned by this turtle.
4616  std::list<PenState> stateStack = {PenState()};
4617  std::list<Line> fillLines;
4618 
4619  //the current transform. This points to the topmost state's transform
4620  //on the pen state stack.
4621  Transform* transform = nullptr;
4622  //the current state. This points directly to the topmost state
4623  //on the pen state stack.
4624  PenState* state = nullptr;
4625 
4626  /* These variables are used to draw the "travel" line when
4627  * the turtle is traveling. (e.g, the line between where it's going
4628  * and where it's been)*/
4629  Point travelPoints[2];
4630  bool traveling = false;
4631 
4632  /*Undo stack size.*/
4633  unsigned int undoStackSize = 100;
4634 
4635  /*Accumulator for fill state*/
4636  Polygon fillAccum;
4637 
4638  /*Screen pointer. Assign before calling any other function!*/
4639  AbstractTurtleScreen* screen = nullptr;
4640 
4641  /*Pushes a copy of the pen's state on the stack.*/
4642  void pushState(){
4643  if (stateStack.size() + 1 > undoStackSize)
4644  stateStack.pop_front();
4645 
4646  stateStack.push_back(stateStack.back()); //Push a copy of the back-most pen state.
4647  state = &stateStack.back();
4648  transform = &state->transform;
4649  state->objectsBefore = objects.size();
4650  }
4651 
4652  /*Pops the top of the pen's state stack.*/
4653  bool popState(){
4654  if (stateStack.size() == 1)
4655  return false;
4656  stateStack.pop_back();
4657  state = &stateStack.back();
4658  transform = &state->transform;
4659  return true;
4660  }

4669  bool pushGeometry(const Transform& t, AbstractDrawableObject* geom){
4670  if (screen != nullptr) {
4671  pushState();
4672  screen->getScene().emplace_back(geom, t);
4673  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4674  return true;
4675  }
4676  return false;
4677  }
4678 
4683  bool pushStamp(const Transform& t, AbstractDrawableObject* geom){
4684  if (screen != nullptr) {
4685  pushState();
4686  const float cursorRot = this->screen->mode() == SM_STANDARD ? 1.5708f : -3.1416f;
4687 
4688  Transform trans(t);
4689  trans.rotate(cursorRot + state->cursorTilt);
4690 
4691  geom->outlineWidth = 1;
4692  geom->outlineColor = state->penColor;
4693 
4694  screen->getScene().emplace_back(geom, trans, state->curStamp++);
4695  SceneObject& obj = screen->getScene().back();
4696 
4697  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4698  return true;
4699  }
4700  return false;
4701  }

4710  bool pushText(const Transform& t, Color color, const BitmapFont& font, const std::string& text, float scale = 1.0f, TextAlign alignment = TEXT_ALIGN_LEFT){
4711  if (screen != nullptr) {

4713  screen->getScene().emplace_back(new Text(text, font, color, scale, alignment), t);

4725  bool pushTraceLine(Point a, Point b){
4726  if (screen != nullptr) {
4727  screen->getScene().emplace_back(new Line(a, b, state->penColor, state->penWidth), Transform());
4728  objects.push_back(std::prev(screen->getScene().end()));
4729  //Trace lines do NOT push a state->
4730  //Their state is encompassed by movement,
4731  //and these lines are only added when moving the turtle
4732  //while the pen is down.
4733  return true;
4734  }
4735  return false;
4736  }

4740  long int getAnimMS() {
4741  //300 is the "scale" animations adhere to.
4742  //The longest animation is 300 milliseconds, shortest is 0.
4743  //This was an arbitrary choice, trying to match the speed of the Python implementation.
4744  if(!screen->supports_live_animation() || state->moveSpeed < 0)
4745  return 0;//no animation means no time spent animating...
4746  return long((state->moveSpeed / 10.0f) * 300); //<----
4747  }

4753  }
4754 
4760  void travelBetween(Transform src, const Transform& dest, bool doPushState){
4761  if(dest == src)
4762  return;
4763 
4764  //Set the "traveling" state for screen drawing. Indicates when to draw travel lines (e.g, when pen is down).
4765  traveling = true;
4766 
4767  const float duration = static_cast<float>(getAnimMS());
4768  if ((screen != nullptr ? !screen->isclosed() : false) && duration > 0) {//no point in animating with no screen
4769  const unsigned long startTime = detail::epochTime();
4770 
4771  float progress = 0;
4772  while (progress < 1.0f) {
4773  const unsigned long curTime = detail::epochTime();
4774 
4775  transform->assign(src.lerp(dest, progress));
4776  travelPoints[0] = src.getTranslation();
4777  travelPoints[1] = transform->getTranslation();
4778 
4779  updateParent(false, false);
4780 
4781  progress = (static_cast<float>(curTime - startTime) / duration);
4782  }
4783  }
4784 
4785  if(doPushState){
4786  if (state->tracing && !state->filling) {
4787  pushTraceLine(src.getTranslation(), dest.getTranslation());
4788  } else if (state->filling) {
4789  fillAccum.points.push_back(dest.getTranslation());
4790  if (state->tracing) {
4791  fillLines.push_back({src.getTranslation(), dest.getTranslation(), state->penColor, state->penWidth});
4792  }
4793  }
4794 
4795  transform->assign(src);
4796  pushState();
4797  }
4798 
4799  transform->assign(dest);
4800  traveling = false;
4801  updateParent(false, false);
4802  }
4803 
4808  void travelTo(const Transform& dest){
4809  travelBetween(*transform, dest, true);
4810  }
4811 
4816  void travelBack(){
4817  travelBetween(*transform, std::prev(stateStack.end(), 2)->transform, false);
4818  }
4819 
4821  Turtle() {}
4822  };

4824 #ifdef CTURTLE_HEADLESS
4825  /*Used to output Base-64 GIF and HTML source for OfflineTurtleScreen.*/
4826  inline std::string encodeFileBase64(const std::string& path){
4827  std::ifstream file(path, std::ios::binary | std::ios::ate);
4828  std::streamsize size = file.tellg();
4829  file.seekg(0, std::ios::beg);
4830 
4831  std::vector<unsigned char> buffer(size, 0);
4832  file.read((char*)buffer.data(), size);
4833  return base64::encode(buffer);
4834  }

4967 
4968  virtual void redraw(bool invalidate = false){
4969  if (isclosed())
4970  return;
4971  int fromBack = 0;
4972  bool hasInvalidated = invalidate;
4973 
4974  //Handle resizes.
4975 
4976  if (lastTotalObjects <= objects.size()) {
4977  fromBack = static_cast<int>(objects.size() - lastTotalObjects);
4978  }
4979 
4980  if (hasInvalidated) {
4981  canvas.draw_rectangle(0, 0, canvas.width(), canvas.height(), backgroundColor.rgbPtr());
4982  redrawCounter = 0;//Forced redraw due to canvas invalidation.
4983  } else {
4984  if(redrawCounterMax == 0){
4985  return;
4986  }
4987 
4988  redrawCounter++;
4989 
4990  if (redrawCounter >= redrawCounterMax) {
4991  redrawCounter = 0;
4992  } else {
4993  return;
4994  }
4995  }
4996 
4997  auto latestIter = !hasInvalidated ? std::prev(objects.end(), fromBack) : objects.begin();
4998 
4999  Transform screen = screentransform();
5000  while (latestIter != objects.end()) {
5001  SceneObject& object = *latestIter;
5002  const Transform t(screen.copyConcatenate(object.transform));
5003 
5004  object.geom->draw(t, canvas);
5005 
5006  latestIter++;
5007  }
5008 
5009  if (canvas.width() != turtleComposite.width() || canvas.height() != turtleComposite.height()) {
5010  turtleComposite.assign(canvas);
5011  } else {
5012  //This works off the assumption that drawImage is accelerated.
5013  //There might be a more efficient way to do this, however.
5014  turtleComposite.draw_image(0, 0, canvas);
5015  }
5016 
5017  for (Turtle* turt : turtles)
5018  turt->draw(screen, turtleComposite);
5019 
5020  lastTotalObjects = static_cast<int>(objects.size());
5021 
5022  /* The following code takes the place of swapping the display buffer for the canvas,
5023  * which is what the interactive mode does.*/
5024 
5025  //This copy is NOT efficient.
5026  //We should be able to take advantage of loop unrolling here
5027  for(int x = 0; x < CTURTLE_HEADLESS_WIDTH; x++){
5028  for(int y = 0; y < CTURTLE_HEADLESS_HEIGHT; y++){
5029  uint8_t* pixel = (&gifWriteBuffer[(y*CTURTLE_HEADLESS_WIDTH+x)*4]);
5030 
5031  pixel[0] = turtleComposite(x,y,0);
5032  pixel[1] = turtleComposite(x,y,1);
5033  pixel[2] = turtleComposite(x,y,2);
5034  pixel[3] = 255;
5035  }
5036  }
5037 
5038  //GIF frames are measured in centiseconds, thus the /10 on the delayMS...
5039  jo_gif_frame(&gif, gifWriteBuffer, delayMS / 10, true);
5040  }
5041

5043  return Transform().translate(canvas.width()/2, canvas.height()/2).scale(1, -1.0f);
5044  }

5312  void update(bool invalidateDraw = false, bool processInput = true){
5313  /*Resize canvas when necessary.*/
5314  if (display.is_resized()) {
5315  display.resize();
5316  invalidateDraw = true;
5317  }
5318  redraw(invalidateDraw);
5319 
5320  if (processInput && !timerBindings.empty()) {
5321  //Call timer bindings first.
5322  uint64_t curTime = detail::epochTime();
5323  for (auto& timer : timerBindings) {
5324  auto& func = std::get<0>(timer);
5325  uint64_t reqTime = std::get<1>(timer);
5326  uint64_t& lastCalled = std::get<2>(timer);
5327 
5328  if (curTime >= lastCalled + reqTime) {
5329  lastCalled = curTime;
5330  func();
5331  }
5332  }
5333  }
5334 
5336  if (cachedEvents.empty() || !processInput)
5337  return; //No events to process.
5338 
5339  //lock event cache to avoid race conditions
5340  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5341 
5342  for (InputEvent& event : cachedEvents) {
5343  if (event.type) {//process keyboard event
5344  KeyFunc& keyFunc = *reinterpret_cast<KeyFunc*> (event.cbPointer);
5345  keyFunc();
5346  } else {//process mouse event
5347  MouseFunc& mFunc = *reinterpret_cast<MouseFunc*> (event.cbPointer);
5348  mFunc(event.mX, event.mY);
5349  }
5350  }
5351 
5352  cachedEvents.clear();
5353  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5354  }

5429  void redraw(bool invalidate = false){
5430  if (isclosed())
5431  return;
5432  int fromBack = 0;
5433  bool hasInvalidated = invalidate;
5434 
5435  //Handle resizes.
5436  if (display.window_width() != canvas.width() || display.window_height() != canvas.height()) {
5437  canvas.resize(display);
5438  hasInvalidated = true;
5439  }
5440 
5441  if (lastTotalObjects <= objects.size()) {
5442  fromBack = static_cast<int>(objects.size() - lastTotalObjects);
5443  }
5444 
5445  if (hasInvalidated) {
5446  if(!backgroundImage.is_empty()) canvas.assign(backgroundImage);
5447  else canvas.draw_rectangle(0, 0, canvas.width(), canvas.height(), backgroundColor.rgbPtr());
5448 
5449  redrawCounter = 0;//Forced redraw due to canvas invalidation.
5450  } else {
5451  if(redrawCounterMax == 0)//tracer settings may disable rendering for a short time...
5452  return;
5453  redrawCounter++;
5454 
5455  if(redrawCounter >= redrawCounterMax)
5456  redrawCounter = 0;
5457  else return;
5458  }
5459 
5460  //get the iterator pointing to the oldest scene object that hasn't been drawn yet
5461  //if the scene has been invalidated, the latest object is the first one in the scene.
5462  //otherwise,
5463  auto latestIter = !hasInvalidated ? std::prev(objects.end(), fromBack) : objects.begin();
5464 
5465  Transform screen = screentransform();
5466  while (latestIter != objects.end()) {
5467  SceneObject& object = *latestIter;
5468  const Transform t(screen.copyConcatenate(object.transform));
5469  object.geom->draw(t, canvas);
5470 
5471  latestIter++;
5472  }
5473 
5474  if (canvas.width() != turtleComposite.width() || canvas.height() != turtleComposite.height()) {
5475  turtleComposite.assign(canvas);
5476  } else {
5477  //This works off the assumption that drawImage is accelerated.
5478  //There might be a more efficient way to do this, however.
5479  turtleComposite.draw_image(0, 0, canvas);
5480  }
5481 
5482  for (Turtle* turt : turtles)
5483  turt->draw(screen, turtleComposite);
5484 
5485  lastTotalObjects = static_cast<int>(objects.size());
5486  display.display(turtleComposite);
5487  detail::sleep(delayMS);
5488  }

5494  Transform screentransform() const {
5495  //Scale negatively on Y axis to match
5496  //Python's coordinate system.
5497  //without this scaling, top left is 0,0
5498  //instead of the bottom left (which is 0,Y without the scaling)
5499  return Transform().translate(canvas.width()/2, canvas.height()/2).scale(1, -1.0f);
5500  }

5505  void onkeypress(KeyFunc func, KeyboardKey key) {
5506  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5507  //determine if key list exists
5508  if (keyBindings[0].find(key) == keyBindings[0].end()) {
5509  keyBindings[0][key] = std::list<KeyFunc>();
5510  }
5511  //then push it to the end of the list
5512  keyBindings[0][key].push_back(func);
5513  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5514  }
5515 
5519  virtual void onkeyrelease(KeyFunc func, KeyboardKey key) {
5520  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5521  //determine if key list exists, if not, make one
5522  if (keyBindings[1].find(key) == keyBindings[1].end()) {
5523  keyBindings[1][key] = std::list<KeyFunc>();
5524  }
5525  //then push it to the end of the list
5526  keyBindings[1][key].push_back(func);
5527  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5528  }

5643  //This image copies the canvas and has
5644  //turtles drawn to it to avoid redrawing a "busy" canvas.
5645  //Trace lines are also drawn on this when filling.
5646  Image turtleComposite;

5663  long int delayMS = 10;

5669  int redrawCounterMax = 1;
5670 
5676  void initEventThread(){
5677  eventThread.reset(new std::thread([&]() {
5678  //Mouse button states, between updates.
5679  //Keeps track of release/press etc
5680  //states for all three mouse buttons for isDown.
5681  //*importantly, this allows us to avoid repeated events.
5682  bool mButtons[3] = {false, false, false};
5683  //Same thing for keys here.
5684  //(this is a list of keys marked as being in a "down" state)
5685  std::list<KeyboardKey> mKeys;
5686 
5687  while (!display.is_closed() && !killEventThread) {
5688  //Updates all input.
5689  if (!display.is_event()) {
5690  std::this_thread::yield();
5691  continue;
5692  }
5693 
5694  eventCacheMutex.lock();
5695 
5696  Transform mouseOffset = screentransform();
5697  Point mousePos = {
5698  static_cast<int>((static_cast<float>(display.mouse_x()) - mouseOffset.getTranslateX()) * mouseOffset.getScaleX()),
5699  static_cast<int>((static_cast<float>(display.mouse_y()) - mouseOffset.getTranslateY()) * mouseOffset.getScaleY())
5700  };
5701 
5702  //Update mouse button input.
5703  const unsigned int button = display.button();
5704  bool buttons[3] = {
5705  static_cast<bool>(button & 1), //left
5706  static_cast<bool>(button & 2), //right
5707  static_cast<bool>(button & 4) //middle
5708  };
5709 
5710  for (int i = 0; i < 3; i++) {
5711  if (!(!mButtons[i] && buttons[i]))//is this button state "down"?
5712  continue; //if not, skip its processing loop.
5713 
5714  for (MouseFunc& func : mouseBindings[i]) {
5715  //append to the event cache.
5716  InputEvent e;
5717  e.type = false;
5718  e.mX = mousePos.x;
5719  e.mY = mousePos.y;
5720  e.cbPointer = reinterpret_cast<void*> (&func);
5721  cachedEvents.push_back(e);
5722  }
5723  }
5724 
5725  const auto& keys = NAMED_KEYS;
5726 
5727  //iterate through every key to determine its state,
5728  //then call the appropriate callbacks.
5729  for (const auto& keyPair : keys) {
5730  KeyboardKey key = keyPair.second;
5731  const bool lastDown = std::find(mKeys.begin(), mKeys.end(), key) != mKeys.end();
5732  const bool curDown = display.is_key((unsigned int) key);
5733 
5734  int state = -1;
5735  if (!lastDown && curDown) {
5736  //Key down.
5737  state = 0;
5738  mKeys.push_back(key);
5739  } else if (lastDown && !curDown) {
5740  //Key up.
5741  state = 1;
5742  mKeys.remove(key);
5743  } else continue; //skip on case where it was down and is down
5744 
5745  try {
5746  //will throw if no bindings available for key,
5747  //and that's perfectly fine, so we just silently catch
5748  auto& bindingList = keyBindings[state][key];
5749  for (auto& cb : bindingList) {
5750  cb();
5751  }
5752  } catch (...) {}
5753  }
5754 
5755  mButtons[0] = buttons[0];
5756  mButtons[1] = buttons[1];
5757  mButtons[2] = buttons[2];
5758  eventCacheMutex.unlock();
5759  }
5760  }));
5761  }
5762 
5764  std::list<SceneObject> objects;
5765 
5767  std::list<Turtle*> turtles;
5768 
5771  std::unique_ptr<std::thread> eventThread;
5774  std::list<InputEvent> cachedEvents;
5776  bool killEventThread = false;
5779  std::mutex eventCacheMutex;
5780 
5781  //this is an array. 0 for keyDown bindings, 1 for keyUp bindings.
5782  std::unordered_map<KeyboardKey, std::list<KeyFunc>> keyBindings[2] = {
5783  {},
5784  {}
5785  };
5786  //similar, mouseb_left mouseb_middle mouseb_right bindings.
5787  std::list<MouseFunc> mouseBindings[3] = {
5788  {},
5789  {},
5790  {}
5791  };
5792  //timer bindings, one function per originating time and delta.
5793  std::list<std::tuple<TimerFunc, uint64_t, uint64_t>> timerBindings;
5794 
5795  //map of fonts. only "default" is initially populated.
5796  std::unordered_map<std::string, std::unique_ptr<BitmapFont>> fonts;
5797 
5798  };
5799 
5800  typedef InteractiveTurtleScreen TurtleScreen;
5801 #endif /*CTURTLE_HEADLESS*/
5802 }
